instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Type C Charging Works, Type C devices Work, USB A does not.
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an interesting case here. MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> where charging is working perfectly on all 4 ports but USB 2.0 / USB 3.0 devices are not working. I have a USB Flash Drive that have both USB A and Type C connectors, Type C would work, but USB A does not. Any tips on how to troubleshoot this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Type C Charging Works, Type C devices Work, USB A does not.
threads.message:
Any history available?
Check diode mode to ground on corresponding data lines; possibly ESD diodes damaged.
